title: Ryan Thomas is left devastated after missing daughter Scarlett's birthday for the first time
text:
Ryan Thomas admitted he was devastated to be missing his daughter Scarlett's birthday on Monday due to filming commitments.

The former Coronation Street star, 35, is busy filming alongside his father Dougie and twin brothers Adam and Scott for brand new ITV series, which will explore their family's Indian heritage.

And, because of this, the actor was unable to celebrate the big day with his little one, but took to Instagram to share an array of sweet family snaps while lamenting the fact he wouldn't be with her during the celebration.

Upset: Ryan Thomas was left devastated after missing daughter Scarlett's birthday for the first time on Monday, due to his busy filming schedule for his family's TV show in India

Alongside the pictures where he was enjoyed some quality family time with Scarlett, Ryan wrote: 'Happy Birthday to the little angel in life. First birthday iv ever missed, 11 years old today wow!!!

'Perfect in every way, I’ve learnt so much from scarlett & I can’t wait to spend the rest of my life watching her grow, shine into the star she is destine to be. (sic)'

Ryan and his family are 'embarking on the trip of a lifetime' to delve into their roots in the hope of seeking out long-lost relatives.

Conflict: Ryan is busy filming alongside his father Dougie and twin brothers Adam (centre) and Scott (R) for brand new ITV series, which will explore their family's heritage

Gushing tribute: The actor took to Instagram to share an array of sweet family snaps while lamenting the fact he wouldn't be with her during the celebration

Doting father: Alongside the pictures where he was enjoyed some quality family time with Scarlett, Ryan wrote: 'Happy Birthday to the little angel in life'

The brothers are being accompanied by their dad Dougie, a music promoter and lead singer of 70s band Dougie James and the Soul Train, as they travel to Mumbai and Goa.

Viewers will see the brothers' exceptionally close relationship – and their attempt to navigate one of the most chaotic cities in the world.

The family are first travelling in Mumbai to try and get to know the country's culture while also visiting the city's most iconic sights.

The journey will also take them to the beautiful tranquil beaches of Goa as they fully immerse themselves into the country that plays a huge part in their family history.

The Thomas brothers, who hail from Manchester, are all 'incredibly excited' to get filming the series, which will be produced by MultiStory Media North.

Waterloo Road and Emmerdale actor Adam said: 'A few weeks away with my dad and brothers, this is going to be the best lads' holiday ever! Get me on the plane.'

Family affair: Ryan and his family are 'embarking on the trip of a lifetime' to delve into their roots in the hope of seeking out long-lost relatives (pictured in January)

Ryan, who is expecting a baby boy with reality star fiancée Lucy Mecklenburgh, 28, added: 'We are all incredibly excited but also incredibly nervous.

'On the flip side we can't wait to find out more about our roots but we are also a little worried as we're heading into the unknown. I have no doubt it's going to be a trip we'll never forget.'

Series two Love Islander Scott said: 'This trip is going to be epic. Not only will we find out more about our Indian heritage but we'll also get to spend some quality time altogether as a family.

Ceri Aston, Creative Director, MultiStory Media North said: 'We are excited to be working with the Scott family as they bring their own unique brand of Mancunian swagger to the streets of Mumbai. It's going to be one heck of a ride.'

Excited: The TV stars said they are excited to start their new project together as a family, with Emmerdale actor Adam saying it will be 'the best lads' holiday ever' (pictured in August)

Earlier this week, Ryan's fiancée Lucy told her Instagram followers the couple were preparing to spend a month apart, presumably while the actor films his new show in India.

In a video shared on her Instagram account, Ryan ran along a train platform waving goodbye as Lucy pulled out of Stockport station.

Captioning the footage, the TV personality wrote: 'A month apart. Ganna miss this crazy man! @ryanthomas84 [sic],' followed by a heart emoji.

Lucy took to Instagram on the evening of her 28th birthday to announce she was expecting her first child with Ryan and debuted her blossoming baby bump in a figure-hugging red dress.

The couple later confirmed they are having a baby boy.

Ryan also raises daughter Scarlett with his ex-girlfriend and former Coronation Street co-star Tina O'Brien, 35, who he was in a relationship with for six years.
description: The former Coronation Street star, 35, was devastated to be missing his daughter Scarlett's birthday on Monday due to filming commitments.
